instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green/Orange fluctuating <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Dead board, supposedly water damaged but the board looks totally clean, almost like new.
Got all main power rails, but <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> is jumping between 0.06 - 1,25.

It's like the board is trying to turn om but then decides not to...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green/Orange fluctuating <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Is power also pulsing on L7310? Check corrosion at <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, diagnostic connector and pin 8 <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green/Orange fluctuating <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Yes L7310 was also pulsing, but when inspecting <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> I could see that the <SIGNAL>SPI_C50_L</SIGNAL> trace looked bad. The connection on this line was broken right at the measuring point.
Just barely managed to jump wire to the tiny residue of the measuring point. Fan started spinning after the line was fixed. So thank you for getting me on the right track.
